content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)'.(For each problem, you need to first present three related but not identical problems, along with a description of each problem and its solution. Finally, provide the answer to the original problem in the form of "Therefore, the final answer is: ".)

Premises: [(1) Each tumpus is not spicy. (2) Every brimpus is a vumpus. (3) Every brimpus is snowy. (4) Each dumpus is a zumpus. (5) Every dumpus is a gorpus. (6) Rompuses are sterpuses. (7) Each brimpus is a numpus. (8) Impuses are not muffled. (9) Zumpuses are large. (10) Rompuses are transparent. (11) Jompuses are shumpuses. (12) Each numpus is cold. (13) Each grimpus is not blue. (14) Every vumpus is wooden. (15) Every rompus is a dumpus. (16) Every dumpus is nervous. (17) Jompuses are fruity. (18) Grimpuses are impuses. (19) Vumpuses are tumpuses. (20) Each grimpus is a rompus. (21) Vumpuses are grimpuses. (22) Every sterpus is aggressive. (23) Stella is a jompus. (24) Stella is a brimpus.] Prove: (25) Stella is transparent.

Similar problem 1:
Premises: [(1) Each trisk is colored. (2) Every frisk is a glisk. (3) Every frisk is shiny. (4) Each drisk is a zrask. (5) Every drisk is a grask. (6) Rasks are snerks. (7) Each frisk is a nrisk. (8) Irisks are not muffled. (9) Zrasks are tall. (10) Rasks are translucent. (11) Jrisks are shrisks. (12) Each nrisk is hot. (13) Each grisk is not green. (14) Every glisk is metallic. (15) Every raskle is a daskle. (16) Every drask is anxious. (17) Jrisks are foamy. (18) Grisks are irisks. (19) Glisks are trisks. (20) Each grisk is a raskle. (21) Glisks are grisks. (22) Every snask is voracious. (23) Sandy is a jrisk. (24) Sandy is a frisk.] Prove: (25) Sandy is translucent.

Similar problem 2:
Premises: [(1) Each blorp is round. (2) Every slorp is a glorp. (3) Every slorp is smooth. (4) Each florp is a zlorp. (5) Every florp is a glorpf. (6) Zlorps are slorps. (7) Each slorp is a nlorp. (8) Ilorps are not bumpy. (9) Zlorps are small. (10) Flomps are opaque. (11) Jlorps are shlorps. (12) Each nlorp is warm. (13) Each glorpf is not yellow. (14) Every glorp is wooden. (15) Every sporpf is a dlorpf. (16) Every florp is impatient. (17) Jlorps are tangy. (18) Glorpf are ilorps. (19) Slorps are blorps. (20) Each glorpf is a slorp. (21) Slorps are glorpf. (22) Every snorp is curious. (23) Sarah is jlorp. (24) Sarah is a florp.] Prove: (25) Sarah is opaque.

Similar problem 3:
Premises: [(1) Each wug is fuzzy. (2) Every pug is a zug. (3) Every pug is clean. (4) Each dug is a zug. (5) Every dug is a gug. (6) Zugs are hugs. (7) Each pug is a nug. (8) Iwugs are not dirty. (9) Tugs are large. (10) Rugs are shiny. (11) Jugs are shrugs. (12) Each nug is hot. (13) Each gug is not blue. (14) Every zug is wooden. (15) Every rug is a dug. (16) Every dug is sleepy. (17) Jugs are fruity. (18) Gugs are iwugs. (19) Zugs are wugs. (20) Each gug is a rug. (21) Zugs are gugs. (22) Every snug is cozy. (23) Wendy is a jug. (24) Wendy is a pug.] Prove: (25) Wendy is shiny.

Therefore, the final answer is: (23),(24)->(25)

Premises: [(0) Every mother has a son. (1) Each tumpus is not spicy. (2) Every brimpus is a vumpus. (3) Every brimpus is snowy. (4) Each dumpus is a zumpus. (5) Every dumpus is a gorpus. (6) Rompuses are sterpuses. (7) Each brimpus is a numpus. (8) Impuses are not muffled. (9) Zumpuses are large. (10) Rompuses are transparent. (11) Jompuses are shumpuses. (12) Each numpus is cold. (13) Each grimpus is not blue. (14) Every vumpus is wooden. (15) Every rompus is a dumpus. (16) Every dumpus is nervous. (17) Jompuses are fruity. (18) Grimpuses are impuses. (19) Vumpuses are tumpuses. (20) Each grimpus is a rompus. (21) Vumpuses are grimpuses. (22) Every sterpus is aggressive. (23) Stella is a jompus. (24) Stella is a brimpus.] Prove: (25) Stella is transparent.
